prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
For API InputStream.read, the API usage rule is: Create a FileInputStream for a specified file and manage any exceptions that may occur.
Read data from an InputStream, and manage any exceptions that may occur.

Question: Reading Strings and Binary from the same FileInputStream: :I have a file that contains some amount of plain text at the start followed by binary content at the end. The size of the binary content is determined by some one of the plain text lines I read.I was using a BufferedReader to read the individual lines, however it exposes no methods to refer to read a byte array. The readUTF for a DataInputStream doesnt read all the way to the end of the line, and the readLine method is deprecated.Using the underlying FileInputStream to read returns empty byte arrays. Any suggestions on how to go about this?private DOTDataInfo parseFile(InputStream stream) throws IOException{DOTDataInfo info = new DOTDataInfo();BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(stream));int binSize = 0;String line;while((line = reader.readLine()) != null){    if(line.length() == 0)        break;    DOTProperty prop = parseProperty(line);    info.getProperties().add(prop);    if(prop.getName().equals("ContentSize"))        binSize = Integer.parseInt(prop.getValue());}byte[] content = new byte[binSize];stream.read(content); //Its all empty now. If I use a DataInputStream instead, its got the values from the filereturn info;}
Please using this api: InputStream.read.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: 
```java
private DOTDataInfo parseFile(InputStream stream) throws IOException{
    DOTDataInfo info = new DOTDataInfo();
    BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(stream));
    int binSize = 0;
    String line;
    while((line = reader.readLine()) != null){
        if(line.length() == 0)
            break;
        DOTProperty prop = parseProperty(line);
        info.getProperties().add(prop);
        if(prop.getName().equals("ContentSize"))
            binSize = Integer.parseInt(prop.getValue());
    }
    byte[] content = new byte[binSize];
    int bytesRead = 0;
    while (bytesRead < binSize) {
        int bytesToRead = binSize - bytesRead;
        int bytesReadThisTime = stream.read(content, bytesRead, bytesToRead);
        if (bytesReadThisTime == -1) {
            throw new IOException("Unexpected end of file");
        }
        bytesRead += bytesReadThisTime;
    }
    return info;
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: 
To read the binary content from the same FileInputStream, you can use the InputStream.read method. In your code, after determining the size of the binary content, you can create a byte array with the specified size. Then, you can use a while loop to read the binary content from the stream into the byte array. The loop continues until the number of bytes read reaches the size of the binary content. This ensures that all the binary content is read from the stream. If the number of bytes read is less than the expected size, it means that the end of the file was reached before reading all the binary content, so an IOException is thrown.
